channel.title: How does it grab the stream?
channel.description: How does the server read the bytes? I've examined the server, and no where does it have anything about reading anything. I would usually expect something like InputStream, or OutputStream, but i can't find it anywhere. So how does it get the information?

item.title: How does it grab the stream?
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.source: How does it grab the stream?

item.title: How does it grab the stream?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Ok, thanks. I was just looking over packaged servers, like 508’s and it confused me a bit because there was nothing in the Stream that said “read from here”, because im basically trying to make an nio server from nothing. It’s a bit difficult, but i’ll figure it out.

Read full topic
item.source: How does it grab the stream?

item.title: How does it grab the stream?
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

	private java.io.InputStream in;
	private java.io.OutputStream out;

Which I found in the Client class.

Oh, and then there’s the constructor of the Client class where they’re initialized:

	public client(java.net.Socket s, int _playerId) {
		super(_playerId);
		mySock = s;
		try {
			in = s.getInputStream();
			out = s.getOutputStream();

So yeah. There’s your answer.

Read full topic
item.source: How does it grab the stream?
